body_text:
I noticed the bug only appeared when there was not a trailing slash in the URL. Every URL on the site is set up with a trailing slash, and our absolute-path util was resolving incorrectly as a result.
I've corrected the route here, as well as another file which was pushing to a non-slash'd route, in order to maintain conformity across the site. However, since the issue actually lied within the absolute-path util, the real remedy was to either fix the util or change it out with something else.
After looking for alternative npm packages we could use, I realized we could just use the resolve method from node's path module! I've swapped that in and deleted the absolute-path util all together.
